cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 475 mi south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north across the west-central Gulf, forecast to turn slightly northeast and approach the north-central Gulf Coast late Friday or early Saturday, then sweep northeast across the southeast United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast near the Louisiana/Mississippi border

weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, Louisiana, to the Alabama/Florida border including Mobile Bay, Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana through Mississippi, Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are possible at Mobile (11 % chance for sustained ≥34 kt; gusty squalls most likely Saturday).
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible for the MS/AL border to AL/FL border including Mobile Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with isolated totals to 12 inches possible beginning Friday night through the weekend, creating flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Low-end tornado threat beginning Saturday as outer rainbands move onshore.
